title: James Norton puts on playful display at Mr Jones premiere
text:
James Norton was busy promoting his new film Mr Jones at the 63rd BFI London Film Festival on Sunday evening.

The 34-year-old actor walked the red carpet at the annual film event, putting on a playful display as he posed alongside director Agnieszka Holland.

The handsome star, who departed his role in Grantchester earlier this year, showed off his muscular physique in a grey polo neck while flashing a cheeky grin on the red carpet.

Dapper: James Norton was busy promoting his new film Mr Jones at the 63rd BFI London Film Festival on Sunday evening

James completed his look with a smart black blazer and trousers, set off with well polished dress shoes.

The star plays the titular character Gareth Jones in the upcoming drama, which is set for release on 7 February 2020.

The film tells the true story of a Welsh journalist who travelled to the Soviet Union in 1933 and uncovers some unpleasant truths about an international conspiracy.

Strike a pose: The 34-year-old actor walked the red carpet at the annual film event, putting on a playful display as he posed alongside director Agnieszka Holland.

All smiles: The British actor was flashing a cheeky grin as he made his way down the red carpet

Mr Jones also features Vanessa Kirby (The Crown) as British journalist Ada Brooks and Peter Sarsgaard (The Killing).

The life-or-death journey Jones goes on inspired George Orwell's famous novel Animal Farm.

James will next be seen on the big screen in Little Women, alongside the likes of Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson, Timothée Chalamet, Laura Dern, and Meryl Streep, and on TV in The Trial of Christine Keeler.

Smitten: James joined his girlfriend Imogen Poots at thye English National Opera's opening night last week, putting on a rare loved up display

Meanwhile, James was spotted putting on a loved up display with girlfriend Imogen Poots last week.

The pair's romance blossomed shortly after James split from his girlfriend of two years Jessie Buckley.

James and Imogen met when they co-starred in West End production BelleVille at the Donmar Warehouse, in 2017.

Centre stage: Elsewhere at the BFI Film Festival, Shia LaBeouf was seen arriving for the screening of Honey Boy at the Vue West End
